ResourceHeader.ResourceName: AIM Cloud Imaging and Particle Size experiment
ResourceHeader.Description: The Cloud Imaging and Particle Size (CIPS) experiment is a wide angle (120 deg along track by 80 deg across track) imager consisting of four identical cameras arranged in a cross pattern. CIPS provides images of Polar Mesospheric Clouds with a spatial resolution of 1 x 2 km in the nadir and about 5 km at the edges of the forward and aft cameras. Images are taken in UV (10 nm passband centered at 265 nm).
